content.description: This is a really fun route with cool movement found between Sanction and Cimmaron.  The route starts up steep but juggy rock for the first three bolts, then the crux is encountered as you pull over onto a short slabby section on small holds right at the third bolt.  After a good rest, continue up on decent holds for a couple more bolts through a second steep section, then finish up with a long easy slab to the anchors.
content.protection: 10ish bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: This route is located between Sanction and Cimmaron.  Start on obvious undercling pinch at the lip of the first small roof right off the ground.

content.description: This is a fun route that begins in an obvious vertical crack on the left side of the wall.  The crux is between the first and second bolts then the route turns into an easy slab for the rest of the way.
content.protection: around 10 bolts to a 2 chain anchor
content.location: This is the third route from the left of the wall between 2 Mules and Lightfoot.

content.description: This is one of the routes on the section of the wall where it is steep for the first 20 feet or so which makes it fun.  The crux is the first three bolts where the route is slightly overhanging and the moves are decently long.  After that, the route just gets easier the higher you get as the route becomes more and more slabby.
content.location: This is the fifth route from the left side of the wall, just to the left of where the trail meets the wall.  The route is between Lightfoot and the unknown route just left of Cimmaron.

content.description: This is the easiest route on the wall,  it begins in the well featured crack at the far left end of the wall, then zig-zags its way up the wall past about 7 bolts to the chains.  The crux is encountered as the route heads between the two extremely large huecos around half way the route as it steepens to vertical  for a couple of feet.
content.protection: This route is well protected and would be a great first lead for someone.  7 bolts to 2 chain anchor.  To set up a TR, scramble across from the right end of the Bear Hollow wall and use the fixed lines to access the anchors.
content.location: This is the furthest left route on the Clint Eastwood Wall.  it is easily identified by the crack/flake at the beginning of the route.

content.description: Start straight up a few large pockets then trends right through larger cobbles to chains. Thoughtful for the grade.
content.location: Start is just left of Play Misty.

content.description: This is another fun little route, the crux is right around the second bolt where you have to make a slightly bigger move off of a small sharp pocket to a good cobble jut.  After that it's just an easy slab for the rest of the route.  If only the rock stayed vertical for more than the first 10 feet.
content.protection: around 10 bolts to a 2 chain anchor.
content.location: This is the fourth route from the left side of the wall, between Thunderbolt and Sanction.

content.description: This starts with a pretty low first bolt. Climb on huge jugs until about 10 feet from the anchor, when the jugs disappear and you're left with really small cobbles.
content.protection: Many bolts, around 12 I think, and chain anchors at the top.
content.location: This is the third route from the right. See topo photo.

content.description: Entertaining moves on a variety of strange holds. It's a little sandy, but I'm sure it will clean up with traffic. I didn't notice a distinct crux, but it felt pretty consistent at the grade.
content.location: Farthest route on the right. See topo photo.

content.description: Really fun moves on a variety of holds. The start is sequential with a crux at the top of the steep section. There is a second crux just before the chains.
content.location: Second route from the right. See topo photo.

content.description: This route has a definitive crux at the steep section just before the wall turns to slab. You climb some easy stuff, get a full rest, and go for a three move wonder on insecure holds. If you fall in the crux, you'll fall like 2 feet to the bolt in front of your face. finish the slab to the chains. The rock quality is pretty solid. worth doing if your already there. My reccomendation is to skip the bolt in the middle of the crux. the fall is super clean and you'll just burn energy trying to clip it.
content.protection: 11 bolts to a two chain anchor.
content.location: 10 feet right of sanction. The first second route to your right when coming up the trail to the wall.

content.description: This route starts at the same crack/flake where Play misty starts, but quickly heads right to get to the first bolt.  The crux is encountered as the route passes the right side of the large hueco about midway up the route as the rock kicks back to vertical for a couple of feet.  This would be another great first lead.
content.protection: Around 8 bolts to a 2 chain anchor
content.location: This is the second route from the left side of the wall
